text: hurricane sandy peeled back layers of
life and on this classic Block in the
West Village
people got to meet midnight the dog a
noble slobbering beast who normally
helps an old-time villager named Riley
Fitzsimmons haul groceries up two
flights of stairs to his rent-controlled
apartment but when the storm knocked out
power midnight became a one-dog bucket
brigade helping to carry water to
buildings where there was none this is
jim dwyer from the new york times i
spent a morning this week with midnight
and riley strolling down the block where
Mr Fitzsimmons moved five decades ago as
a teenager long before condominiums and
townhouses began selling for tens of
millions of dollars Riley a professional
musician was a model as a boy for his
father's book on how to play baseball
that's me this is my brother Brian the
Fitzsimmons family kept cats dogs
rabbits even capuchin monkeys in their
apartment Mr Fitzsimmons took me and
midnight across Washington Street to
West Beth an apartment complex that has
provided low-cost housing to artists
since 1970 brandy Penn has known Riley
since he was a teenager and she's known
midnight since he first arrived in New
York City as a puppy seven years ago
rescued from Louisiana after Hurricane
Katrina during the early days of the
blackout in flood and all that what what
about what did you do about water here
Riley put a hose out his window and
hooked it up so that everybody in West
Bath could go and get water making runs
up stairways that were pitch-black at
the time midnight Riley and his brother
fetch water for friends and strangers
he's a good boy
he's a hero the building is still
cleaning up damage from severe flooding
in basements and studios where residents
had their art work and there was no
electricity or running water for days
but even as the neighborhood struggles
to get its footing some people are
talking about midnight and Riley I had
been walking down the Zune Street and
I've seen the dog this black dog over
here at midnight actually carrying food
a bag of food in his mouth and walking
down to West best to help contribute
he's a wonderful dog great anything and
then one of Midnight's special treats a
tune from Riley who has been playing
music professionally since he was a
teenager
